marketNews.title: Indonesian Coal Exports Decline, Pressed by China's Demand
marketNews.content: Commodity analysis firm Kpler noted that thermal coal exports from Indonesia decreased by 20 million tons to 150 million tons during 4M25 (-12% YoY), marking the lowest export volume in the last 3 years and the worst year-on-year percentage decline since early 2017. Indonesia's export decline during 4M25 was pressed by weakening demand from China and India, both of which are currently experiencing increases in domestic coal production. Exports to China reduced by 14 million tons or equivalent to -20% YoY during 4M25, while exports to India reduced by 6 million tons or equivalent to -15% YoY. Meanwhile, data from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources actually shows a lower figure, with Indonesian coal exports since the beginning of the year reaching ~131 million tons as of May 16, 2025. This amount only fulfills ~26.2% of the 2025 export target set at ~500 million tons. For context, the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources recorded that Indonesian coal exports during 2024 reached ~441 million tons, only fulfilling ~90% of the 2024 target of 490 million tons. The decline in Indonesian coal exports also occurs amidst a decrease in coal-fired electricity demand. The think tank Ember noted that coal-fired power generation across Asia decreased by -3% YoY during 1Q25 coinciding with the shift to clean energy sources and weak Chinese industrial conditions. The shrinking volume of Indonesian coal exports was likely pressured by the decline in sales volume of several coal issuers during 1Q25, such as United Tractors ($UNTR), Bumi Resources ($BUMI), and Harum Energy ($HRUM) [see table]. Nevertheless, several issuers - such as Adaro Andalan Indonesia ($AADI), Bukit Asam ($PTBA), and Indo Tambangraya Megah ($ITMG) - still recorded annual increases in exports and sales volume. On the supply side, the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources noted that Indonesian coal production reached only 171 million tons during 1Q25 (-16.1% YoY), fulfilling only ~23.1% of the 2025 target set at ~740 million tons. Based on the explanation from ITMG management during the 1Q25 earnings call, Asia-Pacific coal demand is expected to decrease by 71 million metric tons during 2025, mainly pressed by China. Meanwhile, Asia-Pacific coal supply is projected to decrease by 27 million metric tons during 2025 along with production declines from Indonesia. Key Takeaway: We see that national coal production and exports may miss the 2025 target, judging by the data since the beginning of the year. This is in line with the potential for several issuers' production targets not being met due to weak production in 1Q25. We predict coal prices have the potential to trade flat in the range of 90-100 US dollars per ton during 2025, assuming: 1) weak industrial activity in Asia - especially India and China - due to US tariff policies; and 2) high coal inventories in China.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know...
marketNews.content: 1. A survey conducted by Bloomberg indicated that the consensus among analysts and investors expects the US will maintain a 30% tariff on China until the end of 2025. Although this tariff is much lower than before, a 30% tariff could eliminate 70% of exports from China to the US in the medium term, according to projections from Bloomberg Economics. 2. Bloomberg reported that since the beginning of May 2025, the IHSG has recorded a net foreign inflow of 83.8 million US dollars as of May 15, 2025. If this trend continues, the IHSG has the potential to end the 7-month net foreign outflow trend. Bloomberg reports that the inflow trend since the beginning of May 2025 could indicate that foreign investor interest in the IHSG has returned after investor confidence in recent months was eroded by concerns regarding economic growth slowdown, government fiscal policy, and global trade tensions. 3. Reuters reported that SKK Migas on Thursday (15/5) approved Kuwait Foreign Petroleum Exploration Company (KUFPEC) to develop the Anambas block, Riau Islands. KUFPEC will invest approximately 1.54 billion US dollars to develop the Anambas block to produce 55 million standard cubic feet per day of gas, with an estimated total gas sales volume of 185 billion cubic feet. KUFPEC plans to reach a final investment decision in early 2026, with production expected to start in 2028. KUFPEC CEO, Eisa Al-Maraghi, stated that they view Indonesia as a strategic location for expansion. 4. Malaysia and Indonesia plan to increase LNG import capacity, according to Takuya Tanabe, Head of Asian LNG Origination at JERA Global Markets. Takuya said that this could create a shift in global LNG market dynamics, considering Malaysia and Indonesia were the 5th and 6th largest LNG exporters in the world in 2024, respectively. Previously, Bloomberg reported in January 2025 that the Indonesian government had asked domestic LNG exporters to postpone shipments this year due to increasing domestic energy demand. 5. Bloomberg reported that Garuda Indonesia ($GIAA) is in negotiations with BPI Danantara regarding a capital injection to improve the company's finances. Bloomberg sources stated that the discussions are still in the early stages and subject to change, and details regarding the amount of the capital injection are still under discussion. Representatives of GIAA and BPI Danantara have not commented on this issue. 6. Apexindo Pratama Duta ($APEX) secured a contract valued at 25 million US dollars from PT Pertamina Hulu Mahakam for offshore drilling in the Mahakam Delta area, East Kalimantan, for a period of 1 year. 7. The controller of PAM Mineral ($NICL), Christopher Sumasto Tjia, purchased approximately 1.3 million NICL shares at an average price of 1,047 rupiah per share on May 15, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.3 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Christopher's direct ownership in NICL increased from 0.259% to 0.271%.

marketNews.title: 6 Calm Yet Profitable Investment Strategies
marketNews.content: "Just always remember that there is no such thing as 'buy and sleep' investment; there is a necessity to periodically monitor its performance to reduce the risk of losses and maximize profit." - JPH668

tickerNews.title: INTP Volume Sales Decreased -1.3% YoY in 4M25
tickerNews.content: $INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded cement sales volume up +19% YoY in April 2025, but market share decreased to 28.2% (vs. March 2025: 30.7%, April 2024: 30.7%) due to higher-than-expected industry-wide sales volume increase (+29% YoY). However, if the effect of Eid seasonality is set aside by summing sales data for March and April 2025, INTP's sales volume weakened by -3% YoY. In terms of segmentation, bagged cement sales in March and April 2025 grew by +2.4% YoY, while bulk cement sales declined by -14.5% YoY. Over 4M25, INTP's sales volume decreased by -1.3% YoY (vs. 4M24: +7.1% YoY), in line with industry-wide sales which also decreased by -1.3% YoY (vs. 4M24: +0.3% YoY).

tickerNews.title: GEMS to Distribute 2024 Book Year Dividend of $500 Million
tickerNews.content: $GEMS: Golden Energy Mines will distribute dividends for the 2024 book year amounting to 500 million US dollars or equivalent to approximately 106% dividend payout ratio, indicating a final dividend of 309.15 rupiah per share and a final dividend yield of 3.3% as of Friday (16/5). The cum-date in the regular and negotiation market is May 23, 2025, while payment is scheduled for June 5, 2025. Previously, GEMS distributed interim dividends for the 2024 book year amounting to 410 rupiah per share in June 2024, 397 rupiah per share in September 2024, and 244 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: CITA Shareholders Approve 2024 Book Year Dividend of ~IDR 1.3 Trillion
tickerNews.content: $CITA: Cita Mineral Investindo shareholders approved the distribution of dividends for the 2024 book year amounting to approximately 1.3 trillion rupiah or 328 rupiah per share, equivalent to approximately 52% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 8.1% as of Friday (16/5). The cum-date and payment date are not yet known.

tickerNews.title: PWON Completes Tender Offer for Portion of Its Debt Securities
tickerNews.content: $PWON: Pakuwon Jati announced that it has completed a tender offer for a portion of its debt securities with a 4.875% interest rate on May 15, 2025. The principal amount paid reached 66.5 million US dollars, while the remaining outstanding principal totaled 333.4 million US dollars. Settlement of the payment for this offer is scheduled for May 19, 2025.

tickerNews.title: INCO Shareholders Approve 2024 Book Year Dividend and Appoint Acting President Director
tickerNews.content: $INCO: Vale Indonesia shareholders approved the distribution of dividends for the 2024 book year amounting to 34.65 million US dollars or approximately 54.3 rupiah per share assuming an exchange rate of 16,500 rupiah per US dollar. This amount is equivalent to approximately 60% dividend payout ratio and indicates a dividend yield of 1.8% as of Friday (16/5). The cum-date and payment date are not yet known. INCO shareholders also approved the termination of Febriany Eddy's tenure as President Director of the company, and appointed Bernardus Irmanto as the acting President Director.

tickerNews.title: GGRM Injects Capital of IDR 1.5 Trillion into Subsidiary for Toll Road Project Support
tickerNews.content: $GGRM: Gudang Garam announced that the company has injected capital worth 1.5 trillion rupiah through a new share subscription in its subsidiary, PT Surya Sapta Agung Tol. This transaction is intended to support the continuation of the construction process for the Kediri-Tulungagung toll road project built by the company through PT Surya Sapta Agung Tol.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Clarifies Alleged Disturbance by Local Business Representatives on Alkali Plant Contractor
tickerNews.content: $TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific stated in a clarification to the IDX that one of the contractors for the PT Chandra Asri Alkali plant, China Chengda Engineering Co. Ltd., was visited by representatives claiming to be local businessmen in Cilegon, Banten. The company said that this action potentially disturbs the previously set construction schedule for the plant. The company also fulfilled the invitation for a problem resolution meeting regarding the investment in PT Chandra Asri Alkali, facilitated by BKPM on May 14, 2025.

tickerNews.title: FAST Divests 20% of Subsidiary JAI Shares to Improve Liquidity; Shareholders Approve Private Placement
tickerNews.content: $FAST: The Director of Fast Food Indonesia, Dio May Avico, stated that the company will divest 20% of its shares in PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia, a subsidiary engaged in the broiler chicken supplier business. Currently, FAST holds 70% of the shares in PT Jagonya Ayam Indonesia. Although not detailing the transaction value, Dio explained that this divestment is carried out to increase working capital and improve the company's cash flow condition. Dio also mentioned that the divestment will be purchased by PT Shankara Fortuna and PT Santosa Bersama Mitra, acquiring 15% and 5% of the shares, respectively. On Friday (16/5), FAST shareholders also approved a private placement plan worth 80 billion rupiah from PT Gelael Pratama and Indoritel Makmur International ($DNET).

tickerNews.title: WIRG Controller Sells 72 Million Shares for Internal Strategy
tickerNews.content: $WIRG: The controller of Wir Asia, PT WIR Global Kreatif, sold 72 million WIRG shares at an average price of 84 rupiah per sheet on May 15, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 6 billion rupiah and is intended as an internal strategy. After this transaction, the ownership of PT WIR Global Kreatif in WIRG decreased from approximately 10.29% to approximately 9.69%.
